00191 ALIGN_VERT_CENTER        /*      e           */
00192 };                       /*      x           */

00199 // alignment used in QLabel, QLineEdit 
00200 enum AlignmentFlags {
00201   AlignAuto   = 0x0000,   // text alignment
00202   AlignLeft   = 0x0001,
00203   AlignRight    = 0x0002,
00204   AlignHCenter    = 0x0004,
00205   AlignJustify    = 0x0008,
00206   AlignHorizontal_Mask  = AlignLeft | AlignRight | AlignHCenter | AlignJustify,
00207   AlignTop    = 0x0010,
00208   AlignBottom   = 0x0020,
00209   AlignVCenter    = 0x0040,
00210   AlignVertical_Mask  = AlignTop | AlignBottom | AlignVCenter,
00211   AlignCenter   = AlignVCenter | AlignHCenter
00212 };

00214 enum TextFlags {
00215   SingleLine    = 0x0080, // misc. flags
00216   DontClip      = 0x0100,
00217   ExpandTabs    = 0x0200,
00218   ShowPrefix    = 0x0400,
00219   WordBreak     = 0x0800,
00220   BreakAnywhere = 0x1000,
00221   DontPrint     = 0x2000,
00222   Underline     = 0x01000000,
00223   Overline      = 0x02000000,
00224   StrikeOut     = 0x04000000,
00225   IncludeTrailingSpaces = 0x08000000,
00226   NoAccel       = 0x4000
00227 };

00229 enum TextCursor {
00230   NoMove = 0,        // Keep the cursor where it is
00231   Start,             // Move to the start of the document.
00232   StartOfLine,       // Move to the start of the current line.
00233   StartOfBlock,      // Move to the start of the current block.
00234   StartOfWord,       // Move to the start of the current word.
00235   PreviousBlock,     // Move to the start of the previous block.
00236   PreviousCharacter, // Move to the previous character.
00237   PreviousWord,      // Move to the beginning of the previous word.
00238   Up,                // Move up one line.
00239   Left,              // Move left one character.
00240   WordLeft,          // Move left one word.
00241   End,               // Move to the end of the document.
00242   EndOfLine,         // Move to the end of the current line.
00243   EndOfWord,         // Move to the end of the current word.
00244   EndOfBlock,        // Move to the end of the current block.
00245   NextBlock,         // Move to the beginning of the next block.
00246   NextCharacter,     // Move to the next character.
00247   NextWord,          // Move to the next word.
00248   Down,              // Move down one line.
00249   Right,             // Move right one character.
00250   WordRight
00251 };

00300 /* definitions for MouseShape */
00301 enum MouseShape {
00302   ArrowCursor          = 0, //   The standard arrow cursor.
00303   UpArrowCursor        = 1, //   An arrow pointing upwards toward the top of the screen.
00304   CrossCursor          = 2, //  A crosshair cursor,
00305                           //typically used to help the user accurately select a point on the screen.
00306   WaitCursor           = 3, // An hourglass or watch cursor,
00307                           // usually shown during operations that prevent the user
00308                           // from interacting with the application.
00309   IBeamCursor          = 4, // A caret or ibeam cursor, indicating that a widget can accept and display text input.
00310   SizeVerCursor        = 5, // A cursor used for elements that are used to vertically resize top-level windows.
00311   SizeHorCursor        = 6, // A cursor used for elements that are used to horizontally resize top-level windows.
00312   SizeFDiagCursor      = 8, // A cursor used for elements that are used to diagonally resize top-level
00313                           // windows at their top-left and bottom-right corners.
00314   SizeBDiagCursor      = 7, // A cursor used for elements that are used to diagonally resize top-level
00315                           // windows at their top-right and bottom-left corners.
00316   SizeAllCursor        = 9, // A cursor used for elements that are used to resize top-level windows in any direction.
00317   BlankCursor         = 10, // A blank/invisible cursor, typically used when the cursor shape needs to be hidden.
00318   SplitVCursor        = 11, // A cursor used for vertical splitters, indicating that a handle can be
00319                           // dragged horizontally to adjust the use of available space.
00320   SplitHCursor        = 12, // A cursor used for horizontal splitters, indicating that a handle can be
00321                           // dragged vertically to adjust the use of available space.
00322   PointingHandCursor  = 13, // A pointing hand cursor that is typically used for clickable elements
00323                           // such as hyperlinks.
00324   ForbiddenCursor     = 14, // A slashed circle cursor, typically used during drag and drop operations to
00325                           // indicate that dragged content cannot be dropped on particular widgets
00326                           // or inside certain regions.
00327   OpenHandCursor      = 17, // A cursor representing an open hand, typically used to indicate that the area
00328                           // under the cursor is the visible part of a canvas that the user
00329                           // can click and drag in order to scroll around.
00330   ClosedHandCursor    = 18, // A cursor representing an open hand, typically used to indicate that a
00331                           // dragging operation is in progress that involves scrolling.
00332   WhatsThisCursor     = 15, // An arrow with a question mark, typically used
00333   BusyCursor          = 16
00334 };

00450 typedef struct
00451 {

00456 PARSE_EVENT_STRUCT;
00457 
00458 /* thread parameters */
00459 typedef struct _PARAM_
00460 {
00461   int  s;                                /* socket                             */
00462   int  os;                               /* original socket                    */
00463   int  port;                             /* our port                           */
00464   int  language;                         /* language or DEFAULT_LANGUAGE       */
00465   int  convert_units;                    /* 1 if units must be converted       */
00466   FILE *fp;                              /* filepointer                        */
00467   int  sleep;                            /* sleep time in milliseconds         */
00468   int  (*cleanup)(void *);               /* cleanup for user code              */
00469   void *app_data;                        /* application data for cleanup       */
00470   void *user;                            /* pointer to user data               */
00471   char *clipboard;                       /* pointer to clipboard text | NULL   */
00472   long clipboard_length;                 /* sizeof clipboard contents          */
00473   int  modal;                            /* modal dialog                       */
00474   int  (*readData)(void *d);             /* modal dialog                       */
00475   int  (*showData)(_PARAM_ *p, void *d); /* modal dialog                       */
00476   void *modal_d;                         /* modal dialog                       */
00477   void *modalUserData;                   /* modal dialog                       */
00478   PARSE_EVENT_STRUCT parse_event_struct;
00479   float *x;                              /* array buffer for script language   */
00480   float *y;                              /* array buffer for script language   */
00481   int   nxy;                             /* number of elements in arry         */
00482   char  url[MAX_PRINTF_LENGTH];          /* url the client is using            */
00483   char  initial_mask[MAX_PRINTF_LENGTH]; /* initial mask user wants to see     */
00484   char  file_prefix[32];                 /* prefix for temporary files         */
00485                                          /* files with this prefix will be     */
00486                                          /* deleted on connection lost         */
00487   int   free;                            /* free structure                     */
00488   char  version[32];                     /* pvbrowser VERSION of client        */
00489   int   exit_on_bind_error;              /* exit if we can not bind on port    */
00490   int   hello_counter;                   /* for thread timeout if no @hello    */
00491   int   local_milliseconds;              /* time of last call to select()      */
00492   int   force_null_event;                /* force null_event for better update */
00493                                          /* if the user has tabs within his    */
00494                                          /* client the invisible tab are       */
00495                                          /* paused by default                  */
00496   int   allow_pause;                     /* 0 not allowed else allowed         */
00497   int   pause;                           /* pause=1 if tab invisible else 0    */
00498                                          /* you can test pause in NULL_EVENT   */
00499   int   my_pvlock_count;                 /* used to avoid deadlock by repeated */
00500                                          /* call of pvlock                     */                                       
00501   int   num_additional_widgets;          /* additional widgets after           */
00502                                          /* ID_END_OF_WIDGETS                  */
00503   int   mouse_x,  mouse_y;               /* last mouse pos when pressed        */
00504   char  *mytext;                         /* buffer for internal use only       */
00505 }PARAM;

02484 
02495 int pvGlBegin(PARAM *p, int id);
02496 // /*! <pre>
02497 // This class is for reading a font for use within OpenGL 
02498 // </pre> */
02499 class glFont
02500 {
02501 public:
02502   glFont();
02503   ~glFont();
02507   int  read(const char *filename);
02511   int  lineHeight();
02515   int  charWidth(unsigned char c);
02519   int  stringWidth(const char *str);
02524   void drawString(float x, float y, const char *str);
02528   void setZoom(float factor);
02532   void setRotation(int angle);
02536   void setFontSize(int pitch, float factor);
02537 
02538 private:
02539   // Information about a glyph. Tex_y2 can be calculated from tex_y1
02540   // and _tex_line_height (see below). Advance is the width of the
02541   // glyph in screen space.
02542   struct Glyph
02543   {
02544     float tex_x1, tex_y1, tex_x2;
02545     int advance;
02546   };
02547   // An array to store the glyphs.
02548   //Glyph* _glyphs;
02549   Glyph  _glyphs[256];
02550   // A table to quickly get the glyph belonging to a character.
02551   Glyph* _table[256];
02552   // The line height, in screen space and in texture space, and the
02553   // OpenGL id of the font texture.
02554   GLuint _line_height, _texture;
02555   float _tex_line_height;
02556   double zoom,zoom0;
02557   int    angle_128x128;
02558 };
02566 int pvSendOpenGL(PARAM *p, const char *filename, GLuint *listarray, int max_array, glFont *proportional=NULL, glFont *fixed=NULL);
02570 int pvGlEnd(PARAM *p); // end of group
